mn42:3.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn42:3.3: Now at that time the brahmins and householders of Verañja were residing in Sāvatthī on some business.
mn42:3.4: The brahmins and householders of Verañja heard:
mn42:3.5: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn42:7.1: “Householders, a person of unprincipled and unjust conduct is threefold by way of body, fourfold by way of speech, and threefold by way of mind. …” … (The remainder of this discourse is identical with MN 41.)
